alert.note: Alert for Northeast Bighorn Mountains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 11 at 2:11AM MST until December 15 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 10 and 16 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...In Montana, Pryor/Northern Bighorn Mountains. In Wyoming, Northeast Bighorn Mountains. * WHEN...From Monday morning through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday commutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Persons should consider delaying travel. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you.
